pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃsenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six groundlessly charged a monk with an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃsessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.4.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six do this?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃsethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhuṃ amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃsessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.8.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.10.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.11.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a monk groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.8.eng: not seen, not heard, not suspected.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.12.pli: codeti vā codāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.1.12.eng: if he accuses him or has him accused, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññī amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃseti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.1.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he groundlessly charges him with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematiko amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃseti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.2.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he groundlessly charges him with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññī amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃseti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.3.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he groundlessly charges him with an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.4.pli: Ācāravipattiyā vā diṭṭhivipattiyā vā anuddhaṃseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.4.eng: If he charges someone with failure in conduct or failure in view, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.5.eng: If he charges one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.6.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.7.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.2.8.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.3.2.eng: if he accuses someone, or has someone accused, according to what he has perceived;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc76:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on groundless, the sixth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sattarasavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six intentionally made the monks from the group of seventeen anxious. They said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.4.eng: that a person who is less than twenty years old shouldn’t be given the full ordination.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.5.eng: And you were less than twenty when you got the full ordination.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.6.eng: Could it be that you’re not fully ordained?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.10.pli: “Ime, āvuso, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū amhākaṃ sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.10.eng: and they said, “The monks from the group of six intentionally make us anxious.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.11.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.11.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.12.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.12.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhūnaṃ sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.16.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.18.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.19.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadaheyya—‘itissa muhuttampi aphāsu bhavissatī’ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:1.19.1.eng: ‘If a monk intentionally makes a monk anxious, thinking, “In this way he will be ill at ease for at least a moment,” and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.1.8.eng: knowing, perceiving, having intended, having decided, he transgresses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.1.10.pli: “ūnavīsativasso maññe tvaṃ upasampanno, vikāle maññe tayā bhuttaṃ, majjaṃ maññe tayā pītaṃ, mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho maññe tayā nisinnan”ti kukkuccaṃ upadahati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.1.10.eng: if he makes him anxious, saying, “It would seem that you were less than twenty years old when you were given the full ordination,” “It would seem that you have eaten at the wrong time,” “It would seem that you have drunk alcohol,” “It would seem that you have been sitting in private with a woman,” he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.1.11.eng: He does so only for this reason and no other:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.1.12.pli: na añño koci paccayo hoti kukkuccaṃ upadahituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.1.12.eng: there is no other reason for making him anxious.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññī sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.1.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he intentionally makes him anxious, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematiko sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.2.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he intentionally makes him anxious, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññī sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.3.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he intentionally makes him anxious, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.4.pli: Anupasampannassa sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.4.eng: If he intentionally makes one who is not fully ordained anxious, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.5.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.6.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.2.7.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.3.2.pli: na kukkuccaṃ upadahitukāmo “ūnavīsativasso maññe tvaṃ upasampanno, vikāle maññe tayā bhuttaṃ, majjaṃ maññe tayā pītaṃ, mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho maññe tayā nisinnaṃ, iṅgha jānāhi, mā te pacchā kukkuccaṃ ahosī”ti bhaṇati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.3.2.eng: if, not wanting to make him anxious, he says, “It would seem that you were less than twenty years old when you were given the full ordination,” “It would seem that you have eaten at the wrong time,” “It would seem that you have drunk alcohol,” “It would seem that you have been sitting in private with a woman,” and then, “Find out about it, so that you don’t get anxious later;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc77:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on intentionally, the seventh, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pesalehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were arguing with the good monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.4.eng: “These monks from the group of six are shameless;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.5.eng: it’s not possible to argue with them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.6.eng: And the monks from the group of six said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.7.eng: “Why are you slandering us by calling us shameless?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.10.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ upassutiṃ tiṭṭhissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.11.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six eavesdrop on monks they are arguing and disputing with?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.11.comm: The Pali might be translated more literally as: “How can the monks from the group of six eavesdrop on monks who are arguing and disputing?” This, however, would not fit the context. Thus my slightly altered rendering.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ upassutiṃ tiṭṭhathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.12.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ upassutiṃ tiṭṭhissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.15.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.17.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.18.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ upassutiṃ tiṭṭheyya—‘yaṃ ime bhaṇissanti taṃ sossāmī’ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.18.1.eng: ‘If a monk eavesdrops on monks who are arguing and disputing, thinking, “I’ll hear what they say,” and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.8.eng: who are engaged in a legal issue.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.10.pli: “imesaṃ sutvā codessāmi sāressāmi paṭicodessāmi paṭisāressāmi maṅkū karissāmī”ti gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.10.eng: if he is on his way to eavesdrop, thinking, “After hearing what they say, I’ll accuse them,” “… I’ll remind them,” “… I’ll counter accuse them,” “… I’ll counter remind them,” “… I’ll humiliate them,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.11.eng: Wherever he stands to listen, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.12.pli: Pacchato gacchanto turito gacchati sossāmīti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.12.eng: If he is walking behind someone, and he speeds up with the intention to eavesdrop, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.13.eng: Wherever he stands to listen, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.14.pli: Purato gacchanto ohiyyati sossāmīti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.14.eng: If he is walking in front of someone, and he slows down with the intention to eavesdrop, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.15.eng: Wherever he stands to eavesdrop, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.16.pli: Bhikkhussa ṭhitokāsaṃ vā nisinnokāsaṃ vā nipannokāsaṃ vā āgantvā mantentaṃ ukkāsitabbaṃ, vijānāpetabbaṃ, no ce ukkāseyya vā vijānāpeyya vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.16.eng: If he goes to where a monk who is speaking privately is standing, sitting, or lying down, he should clear his throat or make his presence known. If he does not clear his throat or make his presence known, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.17.eng: He does so only for this reason and no other:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.18.pli: na añño koci paccayo hoti upassutiṃ tiṭṭhituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.18.eng: there is no other reason for eavesdropping.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññī upassutiṃ tiṭṭhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.1.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he eavesdrops on him, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematiko upassutiṃ tiṭṭhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.2.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he eavesdrops on him, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññī upassutiṃ tiṭṭhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.3.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he eavesdrops on him, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.4.eng: If he eavesdrops on one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.5.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.6.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.7.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.2.pli: “imesaṃ sutvā oramissāmi viramissāmi vūpasamissāmi attānaṃ parimocessāmī”ti gacchati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.2.eng: if he goes, thinking, “After hearing what they say, I’ll hold back,” “… I’ll abstain,” “… I’ll resolve it,” “… I’ll free myself;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on eavesdropping, the eighth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:0.5.eng: 79. The training rule on obstructing a legal procedure

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū anācāraṃ ācaritvā ekamekassa kamme kayiramāne paṭikkosanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were misbehaving, but when a legal procedure was being done against any one of them, they would object.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅgho sannipatito hoti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.3.eng: On one occasion the Sangha had gathered on some business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.4.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū cīvarakammaṃ karontā ekassa chandaṃ adaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.4.eng: The monks from the group of six were busy making robes and so they gave their consent to one among them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.6.pli: “ayaṃ, āvuso, chabbaggiyo bhikkhu ekako āgato, handassa mayaṃ kammaṃ karomā”ti tassa kammaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.6.eng: When the monks saw that only one monk from the group of six had come, they did a legal procedure against him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.7.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu yena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.7.eng: When he returned to the monks from the group of six,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.10.eng: “It did a legal procedure against me.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.11.eng: “We didn’t give our consent for that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.13.pli: Sace ca mayaṃ jāneyyāma ‘tuyhaṃ kammaṃ karissatī’ti, na mayaṃ chandaṃ dadeyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.13.eng: If we had known that a procedure would be done against you, we wouldn’t have given our consent.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.14.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.15.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.15.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six give their consent to legitimate legal procedures and then criticize them afterwards?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.16.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.16.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.19.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.19.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.21.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.21.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.22.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.22.1.eng: ‘If a monk gives his consent to legitimate legal procedures, and then criticizes them afterwards, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.1.6.pli: apalokanakammaṃ ñattikammaṃ ñattidutiyakammaṃ ñatticatutthakammaṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena kataṃ, etaṃ dhammikaṃ nāma kammaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.1.6.eng: a legal procedure consisting of getting permission, a legal procedure consisting of one motion, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements; done according to the Teaching, according to the Monastic Law, according to the Teacher’s instruction. This is called a “legitimate legal procedure”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.1.7.eng: If he gives his consent, and then criticizes the procedure, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī chandaṃ datvā khiyyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he criticizes it after giving his consent, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematiko chandaṃ datvā khiyyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he criticizes it after giving his consent, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī chandaṃ datvā khiyyati, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he criticizes it after giving his consent, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.3.2.pli: “adhammena vā vaggena vā na kammārahassa vā kammaṃ katan”ti jānanto khiyyati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.3.2.eng: if he criticizes it because he knows that the legal procedure was illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly, or done against one who did not deserve it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on obstructing a legal procedure, the ninth, is finished.
